text.text_translated:
A collapse is when something falls down.  
Sometimes we do not know why bridges fall down.  
Engineers find out why after a check.  
Sometimes builders use bad material.  
Sometimes a key piece of the bridge is wrong.  
Sometimes engineers design a bridge to support a certain weight.  
The bridge cannot hold more weight.

feedback.feedback: FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.6431 is too low. FAIL: Fidelity Failure. The BERTScore of 0.8727 is below the required 0.90. The writer removed the nuance of a complete investigation by replacing it with “check.” The phrase “inferior-quality material” was weakened to “bad material,” and “defect in a key piece” was reduced to “key piece is wrong,” causing loss of precision. Suggestion: Replace “check” with “complete investigation.” Use “inferior-quality material” instead of “bad material.” Use “defect in a key piece” instead of “key piece is wrong.”

best_attempt.text_translated:
Collapse is when something breaks and falls down.  
We do not know why some bridges collapse.  
Engineers look closely to check the cause.  
Some builders use poor quality material.  
Sometimes a key piece has a problem.  
Some bridges support a certain weight.  
They cannot hold more weight.
